p: It should be noted that mechanistic models based on R 0 have their own limitations due to simplification; while useful for large‚Äêscale risk assessment, they do not resolve small spatial and temporal scale variability, and make simplifying assumptions regarding homogeneity of the hosts, vectors, and their interactions. Capturing the heterogeneity in lower transmission settings has been identified as a key modeling challenge for malaria, 197 and such settings are often also those most likely to be sensitive to climate. Furthermore, while mechanistic R 0 models predict only the suitability of climate conditions for vector or disease transmission if they are introduced, they do not estimate the probability of occurrence, which depends on a dispersal route from endemic regions to unaffected areas.
